member.name: P:Fonlow.SyncML.Elements.SyncMLSimpleElement.Content
member.summary: Text contained.

member.name: T:Fonlow.SyncML.Elements.SyncMLComplexElement
member.summary: For elements with children elements and attributes. The derived classes use the following conventions to map the schema of SyncML schema to object models: 1. Xml element to property 2. For optional property, the Getter will always check whether the storage is null. If null, create one. 3. For optional property, XmlText will always check whether the property is null. If null, return empty string. 4. For property, the Setter will throw exception if assigned with null. 5. For multiple elements of the same name, use Collection (readonly property) 6. The default constructor is hidden, and 2 static Create functions will be implemented.

member.summary: Create element with default SyncML1.2 namespace.

member.name: T:Fonlow.SyncML.Elements.DevinfFilter_Rx
member.summary: Specifies the supported filter grammars that can be received by the data store.
member.Restrictions: If a device supports filtering for a specific data store, then at least one Filter-Rx element MUST be present and it MUST support at least the “syncml:filtertype-cgi” grammar. The following example shows the minimum requirements for a device that supports filtering on a specific data store.

Specifies the container for the body or contents of the SyncML message.

member.name: T:Fonlow.SyncML.Elements.SyncMLStatus
member.summary: Specifies the request status code for a corresponding SyncML command.
member.ContentModel: (CmdID, MsgRef, CmdRef, Cmd, TargetRef*, SourceRef*, Cred?, Chal?, Data,Item*)

member.name: T:Fonlow.SyncML.Elements.SyncMLAlert
member.summary:
Specifies the SyncML command for sending custom content information to the recipient. The command provides a mechanism for communicating content information,such as state information or notifications to an application on the recipient device. In addition, this command provides a "standard way to specify non-standard" extended commands, beyond those defined in this specification.
Alert types (Alert code values) are defined in http://www.syncml.org/docs/OMA-TS-DS_DataSyncRep-V1_2_1-20070810-A page 81

member.name: P:Fonlow.SyncML.Elements.SyncMLAlert.Correlator
member.summary: The Correlator element type MUST be identical to the Correlator value of an Exec command if the alert is sent as an asynchronous response to that Exec command.

member.name: P:Fonlow.SyncML.Elements.SyncMLAlert.NoResp
member.summary: If specified, the optional NoResp element type indicates that a response status code MUST NOT be returned for the command.

member.name: P:Fonlow.SyncML.Elements.SyncMLAlert.Cred
member.summary: The optional Cred element type specifies the authentication credential to be used for the command. If not present, the default authentication credential is taken from the SyncHdr element type. If a Cred element type is not present in any of these other element types, then the command is specified without an authentication credential.

member.name: P:Fonlow.SyncML.Elements.SyncMLAlert.Data
member.summary: The optional Data element type specifies the type of alert.

member.name: P:Fonlow.SyncML.Elements.SyncMLAlert.ItemCollection
member.summary: Optionally, one or more Item element types MUST be specified. The Item element type specifies parameters for the Alert command. The Target and Source specified within the Item element type MUST be an absolute URI.

member.name: T:Fonlow.SyncML.Elements.SyncMLResults
member.summary: Specifies the SyncML command that is used to return the results of a Search or Get command.
member.ContentModel: (CmdID, MsgRef?, CmdRef, Meta?, TargetRef?, SourceRef?, Item+)

member.name: T:Fonlow.SyncML.Elements.SyncMLSequence
member.summary: Specifies the SyncML command to order the processing of a set of SyncML commands.
member.ContentModel: (CmdID, NoResp?, Meta?, (Add | Replace | Delete | Copy | Atomic | Map |Sync | Get | Alert | Exec)+)

member.name: T:Fonlow.SyncML.Elements.SyncMLSync
member.summary: Specifies the SyncML command that indicates a data synchronization operation.
member.ContentModel: (CmdID, NoResp?, Cred?, Target?, Source?, Meta?, NumberOfChanges?, (Add | Atomic | Copy |Delete | Sequence | Replace)*)

member.name: T:Fonlow.SyncML.Elements.SyncMLAtomic
member.summary: Specifies the SyncML command to request that the subordinate commands be executed as a set or not at all.
member.ContentModel: (CmdID, NoResp?, Meta?, (Add | Delete | Copy | Atomic | Map | Replace |Sequence | Sync | Get | Exec | Alert)+) (CmdID, NoResp?, Meta?, (Add | Delete | Copy | Atomic | Map | Move |Replace | Sequence | Sync | Get | Exec | Alert)+)

member.ParentElements: None. This is the root or document element.

member.summary: Create next and optional last.

member.name: T:Fonlow.SyncML.Elements.MetaEMI
member.summary: EMI might not need to be supported. Specifies the non-standard, experimental meta information (EMI) extensions supported by the device. The extensions are specified in terms of the XML element type name and the value.

member.name: T:Fonlow.SyncML.Elements.MetaMark
member.summary:
Restrictions: The content information for this element type SHOULD BE one of draft, final, delete, undelete, read, unread. When this meta-information is specified repetitively in a hierarchically of element types (e.g., in a SyncML collection, as well as the items in the collection), then the metainformation specified in the lowest level element type takes precedence. This element type is used to set the meta-information characteristics of a data object, such as the draft/final, delete/undelete, read/unread marks on a folder item or mail item.
At the moment, the class does not check assigned content.

member.name: T:Fonlow.SyncML.Elements.MetaMem
member.summary: Specifies the maximum free memory and item identifier for a source (e.g., a datastore or a device.

member.name: T:Fonlow.SyncML.Elements.MetaParser
member.summary: Retrieve meta elements from a Meta container. SyncMLMeta may hold meta data of sync commands or device info, so it is not elegant to design SyncMLMeta as SyncMLComplexElement. The parser assume the data is about sync commands only, no device info.

member.name: M:Fonlow.SyncML.Elements.MetaParser.#ctor(System.Xml.Linq.XElement)
member.param: Meta data including the Meta tag.
